author: From thebillfold.com
title: Finding Free Change in NYC
text: From thebillfold.com I have always been the kind of person who picks up a penny when I see it on the ground. Other people might think thats cheap, or they might think, Why is it worth it to pick up a penny thats been on the sidewalk and is covered in germs and dirt? I pick it up because money is money, and its not very inconvenient to stoop down and pick up. I started wondering how much money I was actually picking up, so I decided to formally keep track of the money that I pick up on the ground in New York City. I would pick up all money that I saw on the sidewalk, the street, and on the floor of a building. If it was on the ground, it was fair game. ... (
